channel.title: Learning by doing
channel.description: Exploring novel techniques and methodologies in the area of massive data analysis, spanning from math to latest and greatest data analytics stacks - like Apache Spark. Also tinkering with all kind of tools and services, including IPyNB, Zeppelin, Docker, ... and the 'old', still evovling, ecosystem around Hadoop.

item.title: Using Jekyll (after trying to get Pelican to work)!
item.description:
Inspired by Izhar’s How I did it blog, I tried to get the same environment, but will go with Jekyll for now (easier to get up and running - for me).

I use the base Jekyll theme (= I’m lazy). You can find out more info about customizing your Jekyll theme, as well as basic Jekyll usage documentation at jekyllrb.com

You can find the source code for the Jekyll new theme at: github.com/jglovier/jekyll-new

You can find the source code for Jekyll at github.com/jekyll/jekyll

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll’s dedicated Help repository.
